column1: +As President of the Family Division Sir Andrew accepted for the Princess and her two children to become wards of the Court. Therefore any decisions about their future cannot be made without his approval as the presiding judge. A court order was also put in place to prevent the ages and gender of the two royal children and details of the case to not be reported.

+Nevertheless, Sir Andrew allowed the media to report how Princess Haya had applied for wardship of their children, as well as for a forced marriage protection order and a non-molestation order, despite the Sheikh's lawyers for those details to be subject to reporting restrictions. Sir Andrew ruled that “there is a public interest in the public understanding, in very broad terms, proceedings that are before the court.”<ref>{{Cite news
